snippet: As leaders deliberate over the path for the European Union, this village of 149 residents has become the unlikely scene of high-level confidential meetings about the Continent’s future.
abstract: Meseberg Journal; 18th-century Baroque castle in village of Meseberg, Germany, is site of high-level confidential meetings between German Chancellor Angela Merkel and visiting European Union leaders, who retreat to the lakeside palace to discuss the future of the continent together.
lead_paragraph: As leaders deliberate over the path for the European Union, this village of 149 residents has become the unlikely scene of high-level confidential meetings about the Continent’s future.

headline.seo: In Meseberg, Germany, Europe Is Plotting Its Future
headline.main: A Village Where Europe Can Take a Stroll and Plot Its Future
headline.print_headline: A Village Where Europe Can Take a Stroll and Plot Its Future
